text: hi children Megan and I'm going to tell
you about my culture shock experience
shock experience in Korea so when I
first started learning Korean they
decided to teach us about the Korean
family names so we learned only Papa
some tone and all the other words
reached the Korean family so what we
learned was that the word Appa means
elder brother they didn't tell us any
other meaning just Appa brother
so I said okay okay oh five brother Ben
so with that in mind I'm I'm walking
along the street one day normal day as
usual and I see a boy and a girl they're
holding hands she's calling the boy oppa
so I said oh that's very nice Korean
poising brothers and sisters no matter
how old they are they hold hands I said
that's good that's love
good I'm walking along again I see
another boy and girl they're hugging and
she's like oppa I'm like okay so Korean
brothers sisters they hug a lot in
public that is fine that is that's
normal we all hug our brothers and
sisters right okay but then the next
couple I saw yes it was a couple because
they were kissing I said okay couples
kiss that's fine until I heard the word
oppa I'm like what and I actually
stopped I actually stopped and watched
them well I shouldn't have but I was
shocked that a brother and sister are
kissing a publican it's so normal and
she was like oppa this and oppa that and
I'm like no this this is what they do in
Korea brothers and sisters they stand
and they kiss and they touch and they
hug then I was like I have got to tell
my parents my family Facebook everything
this is this is
got to go out but first I was like I
have to ask my teacher like since she's
the only one I can ask like why is a
Korean society like this you know so the
next day I go to school and I'm like
something why do Korean brothers and
sisters kiss like isn't it's normal here
and she looked at me like I was crazy
and I was like she was like no I know we
don't I'm like you do she's like we
don't I'm like yesterday I saw a Korean
brother and sister she was saying Oh
Papa and they were kissing and touching
and she looked at me and then she said
it laughing and she was so much laughing
and I was like it's funny like brothers
and sisters kissing is actually funny
and she told me no no no no that oppa
doesn't only mean family brother
it also means boyfriend and I told her
you're serious she was like yes and I
was like so couples girlfriends called
the boyfriends oppa she was like yes I
was like isn't that strange don't they
get confused she was like no I was like
uh-huh
and I never kind of got over it because
I couldn't imagine calling my brother
brother then calling my boyfriend
brother and then kissing him now but
after I've stayed some time in Korea
I've gotten used to it and I realized
that yeah
oppa doesn't only mean family it also
means boyfriend oppa that was my
experience so that was my culture shock
thank you and see you next time
